title: Man injured when firearm accidentally discharged
content:
JACKSON, MI - A 42-year-old man had a wound to the abdomen after an accidental discharge of a firearm Saturday on Griswold Street.
The man went to Henry Ford Allegiance Health and was in "stable condition," Jackson police Sgt. Jennifer Flick said.
Flick only would say there were family members visiting and an "accidental discharge occurred" about 4 p.m. Jan. 7 in the 200 block, off S. Jackson Street.
Police were initially called about 4:30 p.m. to the hospital
The man did not injure himself; Flick declined to release information about who fired the weapon and under what circumstances.
All were cooperative and the incident is "not a criminal matter," she said.
Police were still investigating what might have happened and where it happened, Sgt. Jennifer Flick said on Saturday evening.
